title.narrative: UNFAO Climate change mitigation within forestry sector
UNFAO lindring av klimat förändringar- inom skogsbrukssektorn

description.narrative:
FAO har ansökt om stöd på 24 miljoner SEK för att genomföra projektet ”Support on strengthening sustainable and multipurpose forest management for improved rural livelihoods in Kosovo” under perioden 2019–2023.
Insatsen syftar till att stärka skogssektorns bidrag till Kosovos ekonomi och bidra till att minska fattigdomen på landsbygden genom ett resurseffektivt skogsbruk med ett integrerat jämställdhetsperspektiv.
FAO kommer att genomföra insatsen i nära samarbete med Kosovos jordbruksministerium (Kosovo Ministry of Agriculture Forestry and Rural Development), Kosovos skogsvårdsverk (Kosovo Forest Agency), samt Miljöministeiet (Ministry of Environment and Spatial Planning).
Projektets sammanlagda budget uppgår till cirka 50 miljoner SEK (5,3 miljoner USD), varav Sverige bidrar med 24 miljoner SEK (2.2 miljoner EURO/2.54 miljoner USD), EU-kommission, genom IPA 2019, bidrar med 15 miljoner SEK (1.6 miljoner EURO/1.7 miljoner USD) och Kosovan Ministry of Agriculture, Forestry and Rural Development (and its Kosovo Forest Agency) bidrar med resterande 8 miljoner SEK (0.7 miljoner EURO/0.8 miljoner USD). Samfinansieringen av projektet bidrar till ökat nationellt ägarskap och ansvarstagande.

The FAO has as applied to Sida for funding of 24 million SEK to carry out the "Support on strengthening sustainable and multipurpose forest management for improved rural livelihoods in Kosovo" during the period 2019-2023.
The intervention aim is to increase forest sector’s contribution to the Kosovo economy and reduce poverty in rural areas through efficient and gender-responsive forest management.
The FAO will implement the intervention in close cooperation with the Kosovo Ministry of Agriculture Forestry and Rural Development and Kosovo Forest Agency and will closly cooperate with the Ministry of Environment and Spatial Planning.
The intervention’s total budget is approx. 50 million SEK (5,3 million USD), out of which Sweden will contribute with 24 million SEK (2.2 million EURO/ 2,54 million USD) and the European Commission thorough IPA 2019 will provide 15 million SEK (1.6 million EURO/1.7 million UDS) and the remaining 8 million SEK (0,7 million EURO/0.8 million USD) is contributed by the Kosovan Ministry of Agriculture, Forestry and Rural Development (and its Kosovo Forest Agency). The co-financing of the project contributes to increased national ownership and responsibility.

The main objectives of the proposed intervention is to increase forest sectors contribution to the Kosovo economy and reduce poverty in rural areas through efficient and gender-responsive forest management.
The Programme Outcome is that Kosovar forests in Target Regions are managed more efficiently with multi-purpose, participatory approach, strengthened in accordance with the approved Law on Forests and supported with gender-responsive value-chains for poverty alleviation.
The Programme is implemented through three Components:
First Component is dedicated to improving timber legality, trade and law enforcement in forest sector.
Second Component enhances transparency and strengthens the institutional capacity in good governance and implementation of forest policies, strategies and programmes.
Third Component introduces and implements multi-purpose forest management, strengthens inclusive forest value chains for poverty alleviation of rural women and men, and establishes new skills and capacities in forest fire management.

tag.narrative: 13.b - Främja mekanismer för att höja förmågan till effektiv klimatrelaterad planering och förvaltning i de minst utvecklade länderna, med särskilt fokus på kvinnor, ungdomar samt lokala och marginaliserade samhällen.

13.b - Promote mechanisms for raising capacity for effective climate change-related planning and management in least developed countries and small island developing States, including focusing on women, youth and local and marginalized communities.
15.9 - By 2020, integrate ecosystem and biodiversity values into national and local planning, development processes, poverty reduction strategies and accounts.
15.9 - Senast 2020 integrera ekosystemens och den biologiska mångfaldens värden i nationella och lokala planerings- och utvecklingsprocesser, i strategier för fattigdomsminskning samt i räkenskaper.

title.narrative: Decision UNFAO Climate change mitigation within forestry sector

description.narrative:
Component 1: Improve timber legality, trade and law enforcement in forest sector The key by-laws for timber legality are identified and drafted, these by-laws focuses to regulate Forest Utilisation, Transport and Trade, Forest Management Planning and use of Non-Timber Forest Products. The Working Group is preparing the draft law for its proceedings for the approval by the government. The project team reviewed the draft law and provided its comments on the draft law for consideration. A Monitoring and Evaluation tool entitled Baseline and indicators on timber legality in Kosovo and Fiscal Assessment of the forestry sector have been designed and conducted. These two tools are enabling monitoring the implementation of forest related legislation and contribution of the forestry sector to national economy. The training programme on legal aspects and capacity building for law enforcement in forestry is designed and delivered (the first module) to the law implementers. The national Task Force on Timber Legality and Forest Protection is established with a decision taken by government on July 2021. The Strategy for communication and information in the forestry sector 2021 2025, along with its Action Plan is finalized are ready for the implementation.
Component 2. Enhance transparency and strengthen the institutional capacity in good governance and implementation of forest policies, strategies and programmes Kosovo Forest Information System KFIS under final review and fixing the bugs, errors and defects and developing the missing functionalities. The evaluation of the PSP 2010 2020 conducted and results presented to the working group for developing new PSP 2021 2030. The Working Group initiated formulation of the PSP 2021 2030. The action plan for starting with implementation of the national afforestation and reforestation program (NARP) is ready. The forestry personnel and labour force are trained for afforestation and reforestation, according to the NARP objectives. Appropriate training programs on Forest health capacity building are identified and under development.
Component 3. Introduce multi-purpose forest management and inclusive forest value chains for poverty alleviation of rural women and men The methodology for preparing the long-term multipurpose forest management plans designed, presented, discussed and ready for piloting. The methodology for identification and development of forest products value chains designed presented and discussed with all stakeholders in pilot areas.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
